page.title: 03BUILDINGS IN COLLINGHAM
page.content: In the 1900's only a few buildings stood in Collingham,the station which was axed in 1963 was used to take cattle and a post office was on the main road.On Church Lane stood a shop called 'Shack Affairs'which was owned by Scotts of Harrogate.On the Wetherby Road, where the Barley Corn inn is now there used to be a cafe and near to this there used to be a camp site.In the Old Star Restaurant there were boxing fights on Friday nights. Collingham has changed quite a bit, there are new estates like Milbeck Green and Delvar Close.Hastings court has been built which is a parade of shops.Oppisite the shops flats have been built and a garden centre has also been built near to the Old Star Restaurant .Lady Hastings school has been built recently so has the Doctors Sugery,also the Memorial Hall.
